weather_report:
As dusk settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle mist hangs in the air, weaving through the outlines of the iconic skyline, softening its edges. Tonight brings a slight chance of drizzle, accompanied by a muted canvas of clouds that cloaks the city with shades of gray. The breeze whispers from the west-southwest, hinting at a respite from the warmth of the day, as temperatures drift to a comfortable low. With a modest chance of precipitation, umbrellas might remain tucked away, though a light jacket or sweater would surely add comfort against the cool touch of evening air.

Tomorrow promises a blend of skies—the first hints of sun emerging to chase away the remnants of the night, yet the subtleware of morning drizzle may linger until about mid-morning. Come afternoon, expect a cheerful, albeit modestly cool day, with temperatures easing down slightly. Those venturing out might prefer layers, as the city’s character shifts from the shadowy embrace of fog to the bright, inviting expanse of sun. For an evening undertaking, a stroll through the nearby streets may yield delightful findings—perhaps a quiet café or an unexpected corner store full of treasures. The gentle cadence of the weather invites a sense of calm, allowing one to savor the simplicity of a Saturday well spent amidst the urban rhythm.
